uk.ac.ebi.pride.jmztab.model

Class Mod

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.pride.jmztab.model.IndexedElement
      • uk.ac.ebi.pride.jmztab.model.Mod
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssayQuantificationMod, FixedMod, VariableMod

    public abstract class Mod
extends IndexedElement
    Defining modifications in the meta-data section. The meta values "fixed_modification[1-n]" and "variable_modification[1-n]" describe all search modifications used to identify peptides and proteins of the mzTab file (e.g. carbamidomethylation, oxidation, labels/tags). This is the minimal information that MUST be provided for Complete Identification or Quantification files.
    See Also:
    FixedMod, User: qingwei Date: 14/10/13

   int id)

    • Method Detail

      • getParam

        public Param getParam()
        Get a parameter describing a modifications searched for. Multiple fixed modifications are numbered 1..n.

      • setParam

        public void setParam(Param param)
        Set a parameter describing a modifications searched for. Multiple fixed modifications are numbered 1..n.

      • getSite

        public java.lang.String getSite()
        A string describing a fixed modifications site. Following the unimod convention, modification site is a residue (e.g. "M"), terminus ("N-term" or "C-term") or both (e.g. "N-term Q" or "C-term K").

      • setSite

        public void setSite(java.lang.String site)
        A string describing a fixed modifications site. Following the unimod convention, modification site is a residue (e.g. "M"), terminus ("N-term" or "C-term") or both (e.g. "N-term Q" or "C-term K").

      • getPosition

        public java.lang.String getPosition()
        A string describing the term specifity of a fixed modification. Following the unimod convention, term specifity is denoted by the strings "Anywhere", "Any N-term", "Any C-term", "Protein N-term", "Protein C-term".

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(java.lang.String position)
        A string describing the term specifity of a fixed modification. Following the unimod convention, term specifity is denoted by the strings "Anywhere", "Any N-term", "Any C-term", "Protein N-term", "Protein C-term".

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Print modification in metadata to a String, the structure like:
        • MTD fixed_mod[1] [UNIMOD, UNIMOD:4, Carbamidomethyl, ]
        • MTD fixed_mod[1]-site M
        • MTD fixed_mod[3]-position Protein C-term
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
